WorkItem.Description:
The latest nuget package of HTML agility pack contains also .NET 2.0 framework libraries, however, the net20 libraries in the nuget package are in fact net40 libraries and thus target the wrong framework.
Â 
Temporary workaround is rolling back to Html Agility Pack 1.4.0.0.
WorkItem.Summary: Nuget package 1.4.5 "Net20" library is targeting wrong CLR

Comments.Message: absolutely bizarre.. it indeed is targeting 4.0 even though the solution says 2.0. I did a full clean in VS and then a new compile and the new binaries say they are pointing to 2.0. I'll do a 1.4.6 release tonight hopefully
Any update on this recompile?  I'm waiting on the 1.4.6 rerelease as well.

Update.. while I had the fix ready to go my windows 8 install got corrupted. I need it for the nuget builds since the winrt dll is included in there. Then shortly after my entire hard drive died right as I went on a week vacation to the middle of nowhere (Nicolet National Forest in wisconsin). Now that I'm back I have a new hard drive that should be arriving tomorrow.

Sorry for the delay

1.4.6 Nuget Package is now up

Well after UPS lost my hard drive in shipping I finally got it and got a build environment set back up. (I need to have Windows 8 with VS 2010 SP1, VS 2012, SL 4, 5, Windows Phone 7.1.1).
